item.title: Small chest of drawers on corner, 4th October
item.description:
Dumped chest of drawers dumped been there almost a week needs clearing ASAP as when people see things already dumped they will dump more
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ghent Street, Southend, London

item.title: Crashed car, 4th October
item.description:
This car has been here now approx 5 days obviously crashed into something back end of car slightly jutting out into the road. It's blocking the pavement, vert dangerous for a visual impaired person or someone in a wheel chair or person with a pram

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knapmill Road, Southend, London

item.title: 27 Villiers Road, 4th October
item.description:
This tree came down in the wind OUTSIDE 27 VILLIERS ROADThe tree was not staked properly, I myself restaked it the best I could with ribbon but someone cut the ribbon AND cut the council strapping leaving the tree precarious and it fell in the wind, this is the 2nd tree in the past few weeks to come down because the council did not stake them properly even though I tried personally to stake them. There is no reason for this to happen if trees are maintain properly but in our area of the borough trees are neglected, not staked properly, never maintained etc. please replant a tree and this time ensure it is staked properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 34 villiers road, 4th October
item.description:
Outside 34 villers road this tree died well over a year ago. Today some nasty person broke it all at the trunk and chucked it into the kerb in several pieces, this was no wind damage it was deliberate. please replant

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, London

item.title: Outside 3 Villiers Road, 4th October
item.description:
This tree came down in the wind BECAUSE THE CONTRACTORS NEGLECTED IT. The tree was not staked properly, I myself restaked it the best I could with ribbon but someone cut the ribbon AND cut the council strapping leaving the tree precarious and it fell in the wind. There is no reason for this to happen if trees are maintain properly but in our area of the borough trees are neglected, not staked properly, never maintained etc. please replant a tree and this time ensure it is staked properly. We the residents pay a lot in council tax to Bromley council so our money should not be wasted because the tree contractors are not doing their job properly. It is cheaper to maintain a tree than to replant a new tree. Anyway new tree required please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree outside 34 Allen Road, 4th October
item.description:
This seemingly healthy tree was removed earlier this year, please replant another tree as soon as possible please, our road is starting to look decidedly bare and i for one have been proud to live in a tree lined road for over 25 years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London

item.title: Tree outside 119 Mayola Road, 4th October
item.description:
The tree near my house has grown too big and has caused various problems. It needs to be cut. Its roots have been found underneath our front wall. Our new yard is already littered with leaves, it blocks light and my elderly dad suffers from hay fever.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mayola Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please replant a tree outside 48 Allen Road, 4th October
item.description:
Please replant a tree in space outside 48 Allen Road Beckenham. You removed a seemingly healthy tree earlier this year probably as the residents had subsidence which may not have been linked to the tree. Anyway you could plant a small tree or a tree with more compacted roots so not to affect the property. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Arrol Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Broken and part overhanging a garden in Allen Road, 4th October
item.description:
Opposite number 296 Blandford Road a beautiful tree with berries has been broken I guess in the wind. Perhaps if you remove the broken part, the rest of the tree will grow again but if you need to remove it please replant as the council is dreadful for maintaining and replanting trees in this area, i guess because we are not the more affluent end of the borough

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
